Introduction
The United States justice system has long sought strategies to effectively reduce recidivism rates and discourage criminal behavior among offenders. Career offender guidelines have emerged as a key approach, targeting habitual criminals who pose a significant threat to public safety. This essay will critically evaluate the effectiveness of career offender guidelines in achieving these
